oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Golden School

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Rural schools
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: White clapboard schoolhouse with three chimneys on a peaked roof. The building is a Rosenwald design and gives the overall appearance of being pristine. An extended roof covers the front porch and door. The yard is landscaped with trees and shrubs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Education Schoolhouse Photos, 1938-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Golden was a Rosenwald school in Madison County. It was built on the lines of Rosenwald Floor Plan 3-B (Three Teacher Community School to Face North or South Only). This plan included three classrooms and an Industrial Room. B. L. Gilmore was principal and 166 students were enrolled in 1939. Four teachers were on staff.
